programmering

Class Imaging

  • java.lang.Object
    • programmering.Imaging

  • public class Imaging
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for image processing. The functions are created to conform to the syllabus of the course Programmering (DAPE1400 / ITPE1400). Read the description for each method to understand what is required in terms of input data and what the functions return. Also note that the class stores a few global variables and must be treated with care if multiple images are read during the life cycle of the program.
    Author:
    Henrik Lieng

    • Field Detail

      • currentImageWidth

        public static int currentImageWidth
        The width of the "current" image. This width is automatically set when calling the readImageFromFile(String) method. The image width must be stored if multiple images are read from disc, as this variable will be changed for every image that is read.

      • currentImageType

        public static int currentImageType
        The type of the current image. Its value is set when calling the readImageFromFile(String) method. Note that this value must be treated with extra care if multiple images are read.

    • Method Detail

      • readImageFromFile

        public static int[] readImageFromFile(java.lang.String filePath)
        Reads an image from a file, given the file path argument as parameter.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path of the image file.
        Returns:
        Returns an array of the image data. If the given file does not exists, then an error message is displayed on the console and the function returns a null pointer. Note that the global variables will be updated after the image is read.

      • writeImageToFile

        public static void writeImageToFile(int[] image,
                                    java.lang.String filePath,
                                    java.lang.String fileFormat)
        Write an image to a file, given the file path as a parameter. Note that this functions assumes the global variable currentImageWidth to be set to the correct value of the image width. The function writes an error message to the console if an error occurred (could most probably not access the file).
        Parameters:
        image - The image data to be written to file
        filePath - The file path of the image file.
        fileFormat - The file format of the image file (for example, png or jpg).

      • getRGBArray

        public static int[] getRGBArray(int colour)
        Gets an RGB colour array from a coded int colour.
        Parameters:
        colour - The input colour.
        Returns:
        The RGB colour array. A colour value is defined between 0 and 255. The first index holds the value for red, the second value for green, and the third value for blue.

      • getIntColour

        public static int getIntColour(int[] rgbColour)
        Gets the rgb integer colour from an rgb colour array.
        Parameters:
        rgbColour - The RGB colour array. Assumes three values (red, green, blue).
        Returns:
        The rgb integer value of the input colour.

      • getImgHeight

        public static int getImgHeight(int[] img)
        Gets the height of the image given as parameter, relative to the currentImageWidth global variable.
        Parameters:
        img - The image data
        Returns:
        The image height

      • convert2DTo1D

        public static int convert2DTo1D(int x,
                                int y)
        Converts a two-dimensional index (e.g. pixel coordinate) to a one-dimensional array index. This index can be used to fetch image data from a one-dimensional image array. Note that the coordinate will be calculated with respect to the currentImageWidth global variable. Ensure that this width is correct with respect to the image that the coordinate will be used on.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate
        y - The y coordinate
        Returns:
        The converted one-dimensional array coordinate

      • convert1DTo2D

        public static int[] convert1DTo2D(int index)
        Converts a one-dimensional index to a two-dimensional index, with respect to the currentImageWidth global variable.
        Parameters:
        index - The one-dimensional index
        Returns:
        A two-dimensional index encoded as an array with two elements: the x-coordinate (index 0) and the y-coordinate (index 1).
